name: TableRowStyle
desc: The object for applying styles to rows in a table.

items.name: backgroundColor
items.desc: The background color for the table row.If this property is omitted, the background is transparent.The cell background color is highest priority, followed by the column, and finally the row. All three colors are applied, meaning that non-opaque values can cause combined colors. For example, using a red row together with a blue column, both with 50% opacity, creates a purple cell.

items.name: conditional
items.desc: An array of styles to be applied only to rows that meet specified conditions. This can be used to create a table with alternating row background colors.

items.name: divider
items.desc: The stroke style for the divider lines between rows.

items.name: height
items.desc: The height of the table row, as a number in points, or using the available units for components.By default, the height of each row is determined by the height of the content in that row. See Specifying Measurements for Components
